snippet.title: Game Boy Advance Longplay [060] Fire Emblem The Sacred Stones (part 01 of 10)
snippet.description:
http://www.longplays.org

Played by: xRavenXP

Fire Emblem: The Sacred Stones (know in Japan like Fire Emblem: Seima no Koseki) is a epic tactical rpg for the Game Boy Advance developed by Intelligent Systems and published by Nintendo. It was released on October 2004 in Japan, and was later localized and released on May 2005 in North America. It is the eighth game in the Fire Emblem series, the third and final game in the series to be released for the Game Boy Advance and the second game in the series to be released outside Japan. 

The Sacred Stones takes place on the continent of Magvel. It is home to six nation-states: Renais, Frelia, Jehanna, Rausten, Grado and Carcino. The protagonists Eirika and Ephraim fight against invading Grado Empire, seeking to destroy the sacred stones existing in nations, and besides having to fight the Demon King, who owned the the body of Lyon, the great childhood friend of protagonists of the game. 800 years ago, the monsters attack humans, looking for a solution that fought the War of the stones. This time five sacred stones used to beat and catch the Demon King, and those five relics were distributed among the five families of kings of the continent. Spend time with the help of the sacred stones in Magvel peace reigns.

A notable difference of this game is to have a free navigation map, have places to level up the characters (beyond the arenas, has Valni Tower and the Lagdou Ruins with monsters. I took well to train all characters in the game for his second class), characters can choose one of two classes to evolve! And some classes have unique abilities!

This game has two paths to be taken. This longplay was done following the route of Ephraim and in hard mode.

Dedicated to Miho/Midna, a great Fire Emblem fan, like me. -
Disclaimer: Most videos by World of Longplays use SaveStates!
